name: firesign
text:
d. None of the above.

(Didn't think of "Let's talk about your avatar", did you?)

I have a boot of the late 90s Steve Albini remix and re-record of Cheap Trick's "In Color." It's missing a few harmonies and minor instruments, but it's overall pretty fucking incredible and a vast improvement over the weak 1977 production... Imagine the guitar riff to "You're All Talk" in Albini's hands...

name: missionofburma
text:
This is my first account, before I decided on a better name. I love the Atomizer EP artwork as much as I do Songs About Fucking but the writing is so small you don't get the joke unless you already know it.

I was surprised to find that Achewood has a good number of people that dig Albini and Big Black, just like its cool to chat with other people who've read The Invisibles.

Havn't gotten to Cheap Trick yet on my Journey Through Music but from what I hear they influenced alot of what I listen to (Nirvana, etc...)

Favorite Albini song: Trouser Minnow by Rapeman

name: erinye
text:
Oh man, I was so totally not expecting this to come up in a comment.

I freaking love the Invisibles.

name: foetus_punch
text:
The Invisibles is basically my favourite comic. A friend of mine asked me to describe it, and I said "William S. Burroughs with more pictures", which is enormous praise coming from my mouth.

Of course, my friend didn't know who Burroughs was, so I left to find better friends.

name: falseprophet
text: As a black man, I'd just like to say that I feel sorry for anyone who thinks the word "minstrels" needs to be qualified by "nigger."

name: boredom_man
text: oh man if mother jones were here she would need so many hugs from me right now

name: terebikun
text: Since the most common definition or the one that first comes to mind is that of a "medieval poet and musician", without the race angle it makes far less sense.  Although, I suppose a medieval poet and musician could also be black, but you just don't see a whole lot of them in Danny Kay movies.

name: boredom_man
text: Terebikun, if that's the definition you think of first, you were raised in substantially classier circumstances than I. Whether you should feel good or bad about this is up to you.

name: achilleselbow
text: In my case, it just means that I listened to a lot of Blind Guardian and played too many RPG's growing up.

name: shutup_shutup
text: Listening to Blind Guardian is a good excuse for just about everything.  "Sorry, I'm hungover from too much mead.  It was Blind Guardian night."

name: terebikun
text: If by classier circumstances you mean "not the 1940s"/"the set of Amos & Andy" then yes.

name: sustainability
text: Terebikun believes no one has been racist since the 40s pass it on

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i too think of this medieval definition first...and i'm still confused about the racist one being mentioned.

name: pogo
text: Well, it was mostly whites wearing blackface makeup in the American minstrel shows, so I don't think he word "minstrel" is descriptive enough.

name: untilyouaresonude
text:
I'm from the South, and I've met my share of racists. I have never, however, heard one speak to a hispanic person as though they were praising a dog.

Until now, that is.

name: epicurus
text: All I know is you just invented the best name for a cocktail in history .

name: xiaomimi
text:
The Old Fashioned Geek Chinaman N-Bomb

2oz whiskey
1/2oz dry vermouth
1/2oz Pernod
Dash Angostura Bitters
1 huamei (preserved plum)
Soda

Fill a tumbler with ice and top with a huamei or two. Add the whiskey, vermouth, Pernod, and bitters, and stir. Top with soda. Let it sit for a minute so the huamei can "steep" before drinking.

(Huamei are crazy little things that you can find at an Asian market, I guess in like the snack food section. The only English I can find on my bag says "PRESERVED FRUITS" so identifying them may be nontrivial. Alternately, you could substitute with a maraschino cherry, making an Old Fashioned Geek Croat N-Bomb.)

name: epicurus
text: now THIS is what I have been waiting for these last three months. Big chubbies up ins for Xiaomi mi.

name: xiaomimi
text: It was a good opportunity to learn where maraschino cherries come from!  Also, after posting this I learned that one should toss this drink down pretty quick, because if the huamei steeps for too long it gets real nasty real fast.  So I should warn people about that.  Definitely a nonlinear nastiness curve there.

name: aaron_haynes
text: Panel seven is my all-time favorite Beef expression.

name: jlynes
text: Any other instances of an Achewood character breaking the fourth wall?  I can't think of any.

name: boredom_man
text: There's a strip from 2001, "the worst Achewood strip" by many estimations, and likely to remain that way as that's before Onstad was making his living from Achewood, in which Teodor and Lyle admit to the audience that Onstad didn't bother to come up with a punch line. Also, the one-year anniversary strip has Teodor thanking us for our readership and not wearing any pants. And the sixth anniversary strips, which might or might not count... oh my god i've wasted my life

name: aaron_haynes
text: There are a couple of times where Ray and Beef stage events that seem to be speaking to the audience, like the one about IBM and Google's logos, but they could just as well be doing some elaborate mocking attempt.

text: Check Beef's eyes in the 7th panel. Where is he looking?

name: bjorntd
text: At the fourth wall, though I'm not sure that looking at the fourth wall counts as breaking it. I figure that he's merely looking in that direction simply because it is away from the phone.

name: deusoma
text: Yeah, this right here, this is what I was thinking. I blame the fact that I was raised on bad sitcoms for the fact that I make exaggerated facial expressions whilst on the phone, even if I am otherwise alone. Beef's rolling his eyes, for his benefit if for no one else's.

name: zhankfor
text: I have that problem. When I look at a wall, it usually breaks.

text: I did lay with a Jewess many fortnights ago.

text: high five?

name: deusoma
text: That made me laugh harder than the comic. And that was awesome to begin with. Well done sir.

name: tekende

name: werewolves
text: The hilarity is palpable!

name: notcool
text:
Growing up in North Carolina, I can tell you that there is a certain cass of people who would talk to you as though you were but a dog even if you had a fancy Harvard degree.

No status, no class.

text:
i like that the racist tells beef that he doesn't think it is a good thing that he is jewish for the both of them

it is good times reading that

text: Oh wow, you're right! I'd always assumed he was saying it was bad for both of them that Jaime wouldn't be performing.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
well i hadn't thought about it the way reverendsam had..

i had meat loaf for dinner tonight. (this is completely irrelevant.)

name: direhaggis
text: Roast Beef made pickles in the Racialist Rally's bed.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Today's Forecast: scattered Roast Beef pickles on Racialist Rally's parade.

name: galbraith
text: When I read this I vacillate between reading it as pickles on parade like rain on a parade or pickles on parade like a parade of pickles going down the street.

name: zhankfor
text: I went with the latter. Imagine attending your neighbourhood racialist rally, and all of a sudden several hundred pickles on tiny cucumber floats and even more with crude marching-band instruments behind them. Would even you, a most vehement racialist, want to keep listening to the 70-year-old speaker on stage expounding on the best places to find still-segregated water fountains? No you would not. You would watch the pickle parade.

name: zhankfor
text: SENTENCE FRAGMENT
